page.title: 18THE RIVER TRENT.
page.content: The River Trent flows from west to east along the southern boundary of the defined area.The river has many characteristics of a river in its 'middle course'.Examples of river terraces,river cliffs,meanders and abandoned meanders are visible.No major tributaries join the river along this section but numerous drains from the floodplain pasture land empty into the river.The river itself is not navigable by large commercial vessels along this stretch but is used by small pleasure craft.Angling is another recreational pastime offered by the river. The river cliff close to Sycamore Farm,Ingleby is mainly used for dairy farming but the cliff top fields are used for various types of arable cultivation.
